function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Unused car parking spaces being repurposed for different activities could increase the risk of contagious disease transmission if proper precautions are not taken.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Conversion of car parking areas into an open space market during red level situations could lead to crowding and close contact among individuals, increasing the risk of disease transmission.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of capacity regulations in educational buildings during covid-19 alert levels, potentially leading to overcrowding and increased risk of disease transmission.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Exposure to contagion due to close proximity in transformed spaces","category":"Structures","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Congested academic and administrative buildings may facilitate the spread of contagious diseases due to close proximity and high occupancy.","category":"Structures","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Contagious disease transmission in parking facilities","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Overcrowding in parking spaces due to pandemic-related measures","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of monitoring in parking areas leading to obstruction of circulation passages","category":"Structures","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of consideration for pedestrian safety and traffic flow in parking design","category":"Structures","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of consideration for peak period movements and vehicle turnover frequency may lead to congestion and increased risk of disease transmission in the parking area","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate pedestrian safety measures at entrance and exit points may lead to increased risk of accidents and potential exposure to contagious diseases","category":"Structures","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Deployment of secondary research approach from multiple countries increases the risk of introducing infectious disease-related guidelines or standards from high-risk areas.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Adaptation proposal for car parking buildings may overlook the integration of infectious disease control measures, increasing the risk of inadequate protection against disease transmission.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate implementation of social distancing measures in architectural design","category":"Structures","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Constant changes in the environment leading to the need for adaptive architecture","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Changes in building after construction requiring adaptability","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unbalanced utilization of buildings due to covid-19","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Forced reduction of quarantine period","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Enmeshment of smart city technologies with covid-19 management strategies in global south cities","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Fantasies of biological and technological fix in pandemic crisis management","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Tensions between different modes of existence of smart city technologies in pandemic management","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of covtech for pandemic management","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Historical context and legacy of technologies","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Community involvement in pandemic management","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Homeless individuals unable to comply with lockdown rules","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Police intervention and use of force against homeless individuals","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited means and resources for the third smart city in the global south","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of privacy in contact-tracing initiatives","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Opaque development of pandemic management technologies","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unknown impact of technology-enabled pandemic management strategies","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Differing articulation of scales of government impacting smart city architecture","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of unified smart city policy in south africa","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Decentralization on paper in the context of the smart city mission in india","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of privacy in data tracking and monitoring","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Spread of contagious diseases through contact tracing and monitoring","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Misinformation and discrimination in data activism","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Integration of private partnerships in building icccs may lead to security and privacy vulnerabilities.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Loss of state monopoly over data management may result in unregulated and uncontrolled data access and usage.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on digital platforms for managing urban data may lead to monopolistic control over urban services and data, impacting competition and innovation.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"The implementation of safety and surveillance technologies in smart cities","category":"Structures","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Use of enumeration in informal settlements to support rights claims in terms of service delivery","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Intensive mobilization of smart urban technologies during the covid-19 pandemic","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unclear definition of modes of existence in socio-technical networks","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate consideration of the impact of socio-technical networks on disease representations.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate understanding of modern modes of existence and truth regimes in smart cities may lead to misinterpretation and mismanagement of complex urban systems.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inconsistencies in truth regimes and ontological beliefs may lead to confusion and misinterpretation in the application of scientific and political concepts.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inequality in access to technology and data","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited access to healthcare data","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"}]}
